fields.description:
When viewing the contents of each commit, a right click on files changed by that commit provides an option to open the current version of that file or to copy its path to the 
clipboard, but provides no option for directly opening its folder.

!sourcetree.png!

Currently the quickest way I know of to navigate to an edited repo file's location is to actions>show in explorer with the desired commit selected, but it would be much easier to simply right click the file I want and open to its location. I believe this change would greatly streamline workflow in your software.

Thanks you for your time,
Justin
fields.summary: Access local repo folders by right click

fields.description:
After updating from 2.x to 3.x version application again starts with first time login screen where you need to bind your application with Bitbucket account. Difference is that in 2.x version there was popup with basic credentials authentication and from 3.x version it started using OAuth token and local server for validation receival from Bitbucket. Even after rights granting and authentication successful screen, application stays in same view for account binding, just with disabled Bitbucket button. (see attached screenshot)

From logs you can see that problem is caused by proxy authentication failure. (see attached log)
h3. Preconditions:
 * Configured network proxy with authentication

h3. Workaround:
 * Uninstall application and download 2.x version (don't update afterwards).
fields.summary: Initialization issue after update to 3.x version

fields.description: Right now, the Stash Changes dialog box has only one option, "Keep staged changes." Please add a second one: "Include untracked files," e.g., the equivalent (when checked) of *--include-untracked* on a *git stash save* command. I almost never want to stash changes without including untracked (e.g., new) files.
fields.summary: Add checkbox to include untracked files when stashing

fields.description:
*"Create Pull Request"* link leads to 404 . Here are step to reproduce ,
 # Right click on branch name , in sourcetree (Screenshot added )
 # Click "Create Pull Request"
 # Link opens in browser and shows 404 (That link has no power here...... etc)

As per my inspection , on my browser I get this url "*https://bitbucket.org//hiverdigital/vara_koto_web/pull-request/new?source=hiverdigital/vara_koto_web:9aa2535ba9b0:dev*"

seems like there is an extra "/" at the end of "bitbucket.org" , if I remove that and hit again then URL loads correctly. 

I've checked with multiple repo / branches . Faced same issue. 

Seem like a bug .
fields.summary: "Create Pull Request" link leads to 404

fields.description:
h4. *Example:*
here is repo file list
/a/b/hello1.txt
/a/b/hello2.txt
/a/d/world1.txt
/a/d/world2.txt
h3. *when searching 【b】*
 * *expect result*
/a/b/hello1.txt
/a/b/hello2.txt
 * *Mac version result:*
/a/b/hello1.txt
/a/b/hello2.txt
 * *windows version result:*
empty
fields.summary: searching with path

fields.description: When I select a stash, I do not want to see the file diff of my stash, I want to see the files as a list.  Ideally, it would work like the Working Copy view, so you could select a file and see the diff.
fields.summary: Selecting a stash shows a list of files, not the diff

fields.description:
Its about ~2 weeks since it is broken.

Steps:
 # Click download branch
 # The next command is issued by browser to SourceTree:

"C:\Users\Sergey Kuchuk\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.17\SourceTree.exe" -url "sourcetree://checkoutRef/?ref=refs/heads/bugs/3.0.0-beta.15/QB-8381&cloneUrl=https://siarheik_aisnovations@bitbucket.org/ais-msq/quotebuilder.git&type=bitbucket"

Actual result:

SourceTree wants to clone entire repository

!image-2019-02-07-20-27-21-956.png!

Expected result:

Please open tab Checkout Existing and enable button Checkout. I already have this repo checkouted with the exact this url but on different branch.

!image-2019-02-07-20-28-09-522.png!

 

This was working 2 weeks ago. Please fix.
fields.summary: [BUG] Checkout is broken in SourceTree from BitBucket site.

fields.description:
After a fresh start, external diff (CTRL-D) is not working.

You first have to enter the options screen and confirm that for it to work.

This needs to be done after every restart.

Using P4merge as diff tool.
fields.summary: External diff only working after confirming options screen
Incorrect codepage in filelist to commit

fields.description:
I am experiencing issues with tabs not being restored after a restart. I have had this issue happen for several consecutive days and it has occurred before on a regular basis. Figured it would be some odd-case scenario. However, I've recently noticed that there are a couple tabs that do get restored consistently.

I am not able to give more information at this point, but I am willing to provide more if you give me the right directions.

_Sidenote: I could not report this as a 'Bug' for some reason, hence it is marked as 'Improvement'. Could someone of the staff relabel this issue correctly as 'Bug'? Thanks._
fields.summary: Tabs not being restored

fields.description:
I'm not sure when this was added, but current ST always updates submodules when switching branches. As we have optional submodules that do not need to be initialized/updated, we always have to manually deinit them after switching branches in ST. This is *very* cumbersome, and colleagues regularly run into issues.

There exists an option to _"Check submodules before commit & push"_, but it doesn't affect any other actions. It would be very helpful if this could be extended to also affect switching branches and/or cloning.
fields.summary: Option to NOT automatically update submodules (e.g. when switching branches)

fields.description:
Open Sourcetree.

The middle sliding bar that separates the left panel (staged and unstaged files) and right panel (code changes) currently does not get saved as a user preference. This is annoying as I have to slide it over every time I open Sourcetree to get a good view of my code.

Please change.
fields.summary: Save the location of the middle sliding bar that separates windows

fields.description:
Hi,

 

I have ST 3.0.15.2611. Every time I clone a new repo and try to commit/push, I get the set global author details message. I have to uncheck it the first time and then it starts working for each repo. I don't remember this happening to me before updating the version.

 

Thanks,

 

Gail

{color:#172b4d}h3. Workaround

{color:#172b4d} I have to uncheck it the first time and then it starts working for each repo. {color}{color}
fields.summary: Repeatedly prompted for author details

fields.description:
Sourcetree modifies the hidden-bit of the .gitconfig file in the user directory. On Unix, files with a prefixed "." are hidden, automatically. On Windows, you need to set that hide-bit manually. It would be nice and less intrusive if either:
* Sourcetree would not alter the bit at all
* Sourcetree would set the hidden-bit to true
fields.summary: Sourcetree alters hidden-bit of .gitconfig file

fields.description:
From the first 3.x release onwards, Gitlab integration was promised. However, the authentication always fails with the official gitlab.com service or self-hosted services.

!image-2019-02-05-11-35-46-200.png!
fields.summary: Gitlab authentication is broken

fields.description:
I have configured to use P4Merge for both external diff and merge.

After starting SourceTree, I cannot start the external diff tool using Ctrl+D. When I go into the Diff options tab, the path to the exe file is empty. If I close the Options dialog box, then magically Ctrl+D works again, and I can start P4Merge. If I bring up the options dialog box a second time, the path to the p4merge exe is filled in again. I cannot see that the settings file gets modified, so seems to be something in the tool when reading the settings file on startup where a second opening of the Options dialog box refreshes the settings in the tool from the file.
fields.summary: Path to external diff tool (P4Merge) empty in options dialog opened first time after startup and ctrl+D doesn not work

fields.description:
When custom actions have been created they are not available in the right click menu. 
In "Actions" custom actions will show the available options as shown here:
!custom_actions1.png!

However, in the right click drop-down menu Custom actions is available, but there are no options given. Shown here: !custom_actions2.png!
fields.summary: Custom actions are not available in the right click menu
any compare tool does not open

fields.description:
see SRCTREEWIN-9301 for background

3.0.15 seems to have fixed the issue (as described in my previous comment) for me.

(Side note: 3.0.12 did not notify me that an update was available. I had to download and install it myself.)

*Update:* It _almost_ fixed the issue. If I minimize the main window by clicking on the Minimize button, yes, I _can_ restore the window by clicking on its icon in the taskbar. However, I _cannot_ restore the window by using the WIN+# shortcut key. Also, _after_ I restore the window by clicking on it, I _cannot_ again minimize the window by clicking on the taskbar icon.

My guess is that the Sourcetree app is trying to do something clever with minimize/restore and, in the process, has broken the native Windows functionality that every Windows app has by default. My recommendation is to stop trying to do something clever by inserting code into the normal Windows event chain. In my, rather long, experience, this never works out well, causes never-ending bugs, and is, therefore, more trouble than it's worth.
fields.summary: Window doesn't get restored after minimizing

fields.description: I want keep SourceTree opened but don't want to have space on my taskbar for launched program. Also I want maximize from tray as quickest way return to program.
fields.summary: Minimize to tray

fields.description:
When submodule has pending changes Source tree does not display the current HEAD. Since current submodule branch is not available either, user has no idea which commit is current. 

Running 'git status' reveals the current head. Information is available but not in the Source tree GUI.
fields.summary: Submodules lose HEAD when they have changes

fields.description: External Diff Ctrl+D (set to BeyondCompare) does not work when Source tree session starts. Opening and closing Option dialog brings it back for the current session. The connection to Ctrl+D is lost the next time Sourcetre starts
fields.summary: [Bug] External Diff is broken in Sourcetree 3.0.12

fields.description:
[12 second vid|https://photos.app.goo.gl/5FGp7VpmKSmMaFRb6] example of issue.

There are 6 or 8 different "solutions" mentioned on this page: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/SourceTree-keeps-asking-to-authenticate-again-over-and-over/qaq-p/208965]

I have spent many hours on this over the past 3 months and I am unable to get any of these solutions to stick. 

Can the Atlassian team look at this problem and provide a clear set of instructions to resolve?
fields.summary: Infinite Login Pop-ups aren't using stored credentials properly

fields.description:
When I have Sourcetree maximised on my screen AND given that my Windows toolbar is unlocked (so you drag you mouse down to see it) 
Then I expect to the see toolbar

 

Actual: 
Then the toolbar does not appeared when you move your mouse down. You have to close Sourcetree to be able to access the toolbar again.
fields.summary: Windows 10 Unlocked task bar is not accessible when on Sourcetree

fields.description:
When leaving my Windows 10 professionnal computer locked for a long time, when I come back I notice a huge lag due to memory cosumption and an unknown amount of "Git credentials manager for Windows" popups opened (too many to be all displayed by windows).

!image-2019-01-31-14-09-22-130.png!

I see a potential reasons for that: I have a SourceTree always running and logged into a GitHub account through this credentials manager and the VPN connection used in my company timeout at some point which could explain a new login request.

 

I started by opening a bug request on the GCM side: [https://github.com/Microsoft/Git-Credential-Manager-for-Windows/issues/829]

But the GCM is aparently not designed to be a signe-instance program, so maybe there is something you can do on the SourceTree side ? Like preventing automatic git requests to happen as long as the previous exact same one have not been completed ?

 

Also I am unsure why github credentials are requested to me again as I have a GitHub account registered in SourceTree with saved login and password. I also have a GitLab account registered if this is relevant for anything.
fields.summary: Github Login popup open a thousand times when computer is locked

fields.description: I use Django, and when changes are made to any file named models.py, then accompanying migrations need to be done and committed along with the code changes.  I sometimes forget to do the migrations.  Since SourceTree is already watching for changes to files, I would like to be able to specify a REGEX for filenames to watch which, when changed, would trigger a bright orange message (perhaps beside the 'unstaged files' label) that would prompt me to also include in a particular commit the migrations that were associated with the code changes made in the commit.  The setting could include allowing the user to specify both a file REGEX and the text of the message.  Taking my example, when files named "models.py" are changed, then this message (that I specify) is displayed:  Include Migrations.  The display of this prompt would work similar to how the flag displays in the upper right when a new version is available.  This would be SUCH a helpful feature!
fields.summary: Special notification that file changes of certain type require action before commitment (e.g. migrations)

fields.description:
[Scoop|https://scoop.sh/] is a command line installer for Windows, think apt-get but for Windows. I used it to install `git`, and then Sourcetree. On installation, Sourcetree unfortunately misidentifies the location of git.exe:

 !image-2019-01-30-15-37-23-995.png|thumbnail! 

There is no `cmd` folder under `scoop`:
 !image-2019-01-30-15-41-16-610.png|thumbnail! 

But there is a `cmd/git.exe` in `C:\Users\Jan\scoop\apps\git\current\cmd`:
 !image-2019-01-30-15-41-49-860.png|thumbnail! 

Seems the installer is somehow using a a wrong path, and then adding `cmd/git.exe` to it. Maybe because Scoop is installing a shim for git in `C:\Users\Jan\scoop\shims\git.exe`? Go a folder back, then add `cmd/git.exe` and you have the wrong path.

Here is a GitHub issue on the scoop bucket that contains Sourcetree: https://github.com/lukesampson/scoop-extras/issues/1674 In there I collected some links to other issues on GitHub but also in the Atlassian Community, that helped me understand the issue and also provides a workaround by manually editing the path in the Sourcetree configuration.
fields.summary: SourceTree misidentifies git installed via scoop

fields.description:
Top bar seems to be cropped if windows scale factor is not 100%. Attached screenshot is for 150%. Probably the hight of top bar is calculated incorrectly

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/temporaryattachment/ab2b81dd497bc8b0e729e09fbd2c1a1ca24265aa/temp5527265629746372382_Cropped.png!
fields.summary: Top bar size is scaled incorrectly with scale factor 150%

fields.description:
Repro steps:
 # Go to working copy
 # Choose "Pending files" in the dropdown
 # In the dropdown next to it, with three lines, choose "no staging"
 # Select a file with several lines of changes
 # Click on one of the lines in the diff view
 # Click "Stage lines"
 # Notice the file now appears twice in the file list
 # Select these one at a time and notice what is displayed in the diff view

Expected result:

The diff view should only show the staged or unstaged changes, depending on which file is chosen. This should work the same as when in "Split view staging" and switching between the file in the "staged" and in the "unstaged" sections.

Actual result:

The diff view shows all the changes, staged and unstaged combined, regardless of which is chosen.
fields.summary: Using "no staging" view in Workspace, the diff view on the right is broken

fields.description:
I've included a video of what I encountered, but briefly:
 # Tried to check out a new branch
 # For some reason I'm in a stuck state where ST is trying to compare two different branches
 # I have to switch views to Working Copy and then back to the branch to be able to check out

I find this to be a common problem across many of the operations in ST, so there is something odd about how state is managed where it gets stuck frequently.
fields.summary: View state gets stuck; Cannot checkout other branch

fields.description:
When I run the fetch from SourceTree (on only have one repository opened), in the Process Log I see that there is commands launched on ALL of my repositories. It should do it only on the repository I was on. This causes performance issue in our Company because the antivirus and other monitoring tools check all spawned processes and network queries.

I saw that on the Fetch command, but all the command should be the same. All command should only affect the current repository (current tab).

In my case I have 30 (non opened) repositories so the impact is considerable. The performance of SourceTreee is our enterprise is a big concern. Some people start to use alternative product because of performance issues, so I hope we can improve it
fields.summary: Fetch on one repo execute the command on all repos

fields.description: {color:#172b4d}The new SourceTree v3.0.12 is extremely buggy. It hogs the CPU/Disk all the time (at times 100%), the current tab just closes at times when staging files. This has been going on pretty much since 3.0.x was started. It is making SourceTree unusable at this point.{color}
fields.summary: New version is buggy, hogs CPU/Disk, Tabs disappear on staging

fields.description: Sometimes I notice, that after a restart of SourceTree one or more of my opened tabs (I currently have the same 5 tabs open most of the time) are not open any more. I definitivey did not close them manually. It somehow seems to be connected to CPU usage, ie I see this more often on high CPU usage. But it's not always reproducible.
fields.summary: Some open tabs get closed on restart

fields.description:
When I use SourceTree, I often notice degraded OS performance. When I check the Task Manager, I see numerous listings for "Git for Windows (32 bit)" running, followed shortly by a host of "Git Credential Manager for Windows".

Though I appreciate that SourceTree wants to see if there are updates to my repos, I wouldn't expect it to allow this many connections at once. Further, I only have six tabs (currently) open, indicating that I'm not really all that worried about updates to more than those six repos.
fields.summary: Sourcetree shouldn't floor my CPU, & especially not when it's not being used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. see https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/How-do-I-permanently-remove-very-long-commit-message-while/qaq-p/989993
h3. Workaround

None at the current time
fields.summary: How do I permanently remove very long commit message while trying to resolve conflicts?

fields.description:
see https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Why-Push-dialog-quot-Push-all-tags-quot-checkbox-override-the/qaq-p/973403?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic

Issue Summary
started to enter a bug for this but decided to ask the question first...

The Tools, Options, Git dialog, "Push all tags to remotes" setting directs the default state of the "Push all tags" checkbox on the "Push" dialog.       That makes sense.

However, when needed, setting the "Push all tags" on the "Push" dialog RESETS the default on the Tools Options Git dialog.                                     This seems like a bug.

Tags are used at our company for formal internal and customer releases.  Only Software Configuration Managers (SCM) should ever create and thus push tags to the server.  However, even SCM personnel should have the default (Tools, Options, Git, "Push all tags to remotes") unchecked.

There is some community discussions about the problems encountered deleting, renaming, moving tags.   If everyone has the default set to UNchecked ... and it STAYS unchecked ... modifications to the tags can be done without the issue of deleted/old tags being reintroduced via the "Push" dialog "Push all tags" checkbox being checked.

Additionally, on the "Fetch" dialog, the "Fetch all tags" checkbox is NOT persistent as are the other 2 checkboxes.      This would also be helpful to make the results of deleting, renaming, moving of tags more consistent.
 
 
AnswerWatching
 
h3. Workaround

Manually reset the options.
fields.summary: Why Push dialog "Push all tags" checkbox override the default found on the Tools Options Git dialog?

fields.description: {color:#172b4d}see https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-Windows-3-0-12-no-longer-force-push/qaq-p/958869?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic{color}
fields.summary: Sourcetree Windows 3.0.12 no longer force push with submodules
[BUG] WinMerge does nothing

fields.description: Suggestions: codepage?
fields.summary: Error in hgflow.py

fields.description:
There was an input validation vulnerability in Sourcetree for Windows via a Git repository with submodules. A remote attacker with permission to commit to a Git repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows is able to able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.
h4. Affected versions:
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows before version 3.0.17 are affected by this vulnerability

h4. Fix:
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 3.0.17 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

For additional details, see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2019-03-06-966678691.html
fields.summary: Input validation vulnerability via Git in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2018-17456

fields.description:
There was an command injection vulnerability in Sourcetree for Windows via URI handling. A remote attacker could send a malicious URI to a victim using Sourcetree for Windows to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.
h4. Affected versions:
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows before version 3.0.10 are affected by this vulnerability

h4. Fix:
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 3.0.10 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

For additional details see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2019-03-06-966678691.html
fields.summary: Command Injection via URI handling in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2018-20236

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in Sourcetree for Windows via filenames in Mercurial repositories. An attacker with permission to commit to a Mercurial repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.
h4. Affected versions:
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows before version 3.0.15 are affected by this vulnerability

h4. Fix:
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 3.0.15 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

For additional details, see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2019-03-06-966678691.html
fields.summary: Argument Injection via Mercurial hooks in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2018-20235

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # On GitHub, create two private repositories named "repo1" and "repo2" with "Initialize this repository with a README" enabled
 # On SourceTree, open new tab and...
 ## Select "Clone" icon
 ## Enter {{[https://github.com/]<account>/repo1.git}} to "Source Path / URL:"
 ## Enter {{C:\test\repo1}} to "Destination Path:"
 ## "Clone" and wait
 ## Click "Remote" icon with a red exclamation mark
 ## "Settings" -> Double-click "origin" line -> "OK" to close remote details -> "OK" to close repository settings
 ## Confirm the exclamation is removed
 *** So steps 2-5 ~ 2-7 are just for calming it
 # Open new tab and do same except its url/path/name is for repo2
 # On SourceTree repo1 tab, right-click the left panel and select "Add Submodule..."
 # Enter {{[https://github.com/]<account>/repo2.git}} to "Source Path / URL:" -> "OK"
 # "Stage All" and commit with "Push changes immediately to origin/master" enabled
 # On local repo1 directory, create "textA.txt"
 # On SourceTree repo1 tab, "Stage All" and commit with "Push changes immediately to origin/master" enabled
 # Right-click on the second commit (the one when added submodule) and select "Reset current branch to this commit" -> select "Hard" -> "Yes" and confirm "textA.txt" is removed from local repo1
 # On local repo1 directory, create "textB.txt"
 # On SourceTree repo1 tab, "Stage All" and just commit *without* "Push changes immediately to origin/master" enabled
 ** Now the master shows "1↑ 1↓" state
 # Select "Push" icon to show push screen
 # "Push" master
 # Confirm Sourcetree shows error, of cause, then close
 # Push again with "Force Push" enabled
 ** No matter if "Use Safe Force Push" is enabled in SourceTree preference

h4. Expected behavior
 * Succeed force-push, or get another error at least

h4. Actual behavior
 * Sourcetree shows "Submodule Check" dialog for a split second and returns to push screen (step 12) automatically at once

h4. Handy solution (for users)
 # Just push *without* "Force Push" checked and confirm the error appears
 # Copy the first line (Git command) from the error and close
 # "Cancel" to close push screen
 # Select "Terminal" icon
 # Paste the command on terminal, insert "-f" option manually and press enter key
 ** My case:
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c credential.helper= -c credential.helper="C:/Users/<user>/AppData/Local/ATLASS~1/SOURCE~1/GIT_EX~1/GIT-CR~1.EXE" push -f -v origin master:master{code}

 # Wait to confirm success and close terminal
fields.summary: Cannot enter upon force-push if repository has a submodule

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open your global .gitconfig
 # Make an invalid value (e.g. unescaped slash in `excludesfile` like "%userprofile%\global.gitignore")
 # Attempt to open Sourcetree
 # Whatever repositories were open before have been closed, shows repository list with refresh icon next to each
 # Attempt to open a repository, BugSplat crash reporter appears
 # Fix invalid value in global .gitconfig
 # Opening Sourcetree and the repository works

h3. Workaround

Manually edit the config file
fields.summary: Sourcetree crash on invalid path in .gitconfig

fields.description:
Hi team,

We are unable to clone our Bitbucket repositories using “ssh” with SourceTree, whereas “https” is working fine.

We have tried this on multiple versions of SourceTree using ssh but the issue is still same. And also tried on different machines(multiple users with Windows 10) but no luck.

SoucreTree versions tried are:

1.9.6

3.0.12

3.0.8

1.9.6.2

 

Our Bitbucket version - 4.14.5

Error screenshots are attached.

Could you please let us know which version of source Tree is compatible with Windows 10?

 

Regards,

Paridhi Agarwal
fields.summary: Using SourceTree For Windows With SSH Keys

fields.description:
Hello

 

Could you please add dark theme to Source Tree to make it look more greater as Gitkraken,

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Add Dark Theme to Source Tree for Windows

fields.description:
Just a suggestion for the Annotate (Blame) window.

It would be great to have coloring similar to Tortoise in here, as you can have all the blocks of a revision highlighted when you hover, and makes it lot easier to see the related changes at a glance.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Coloring in Annotate (Blame) Window

fields.description: In the Windows UI, there are options in the Log / History window to view "All Branches" or "Current Branch".  How about adding an option to view "Local Branches" which would show the history for the local branches on the user's machine, and the remote version of those branches if the "Show Remote Branches" box is checked?
fields.summary: Add Ability to View History for Local Branches, Not Just Current or All Branches

fields.description:
Hi! I have some problems create pull request in source tree (v3.0.15) for Gitlab CE. I successful add my "Gitlab CE" account with personal access token. In settings>remote account I select my Gitlab CE account. When I select Repository>create pull request... > create pull request On Web, I get the 404 error (page not found). I get this URL:

[http://myserver.local/git@myserver.local/IG/SIIG/merge_requests/new?merge_request[source_branch]=develop]

Without the first server name, just git@.... the URL works. How can i solve this problem? Is a bug?

See my question in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/How-to-preview-the-full-diff-when-amend-commit/qaq-p/979507]

fields.description: Would be great to have an icon on the last commit of the build with the information like in bitbucket

fields.description:
BitBucket repository.

Create a fork with automatic synchronization.

Clone remote (origin) and fork (fork) into Sourcetree.

*Side defect* - not clear is it working with the origin or with the fork.

Via webclient create new release branch R1. Via command line client commit and push to fork/release/R1

R1 and master are different.

Via webclient create pull request from fork to origin and complete merge.

Sourcetree still shows BRANCHES>master, however under remotes following can be found:

REMOTES>fork>master

>>>>>>>>>>release>r1

>>>>>origin>master

>>>>>>>>>>release>r1

Track remote branches from popup menu does not solve the problem, but adds more confusion.

!image-2018-08-29-17-28-21-262.png!
fields.summary: Repository pane under BRANCHES shows only master

fields.description: Add an option to allow merging 2 bracnhes that have an unrelated history via thie git option --allow-unrelated-histories in the UI of the windows version of SourceTree.
fields.summary: Add option to --allow-unrelated-histories via UI
SourceTree installation fails silently

fields.description:
If I exit SourceTree when the window is on Monitor #2, the next time I start up SourceTree, it will display with most of the window off the top of Monitor #2.  Because the title bar is inaccessible, I would expect to be unable to recover from this. But there appears to be a fail-safe in either Windows or SourceTree.  When I click on the frame of the SourceTree window it jumps down fully onto the screen of Monitor #2.

This is not an emergency, I am not blocked from doing anything, it is just ugly and jarring. I mostly try to remember to move to the primary "Surface" screen before quitting.  But it looks really shotty and I would expect better from Atlassian.  I use HipChat etc at work and they are all very nicely done.
fields.summary: SourceTree incorrectly handles multi-monitor saved screen position.

fields.description:
Hi,

When i do a rebase interactively. I edit a message of a commit and i replace the char "a" by "à". When i valid change, the char "à" is converted in "?" char.

Pending correction,

Sincerely
fields.summary: the accented characters are misinterpreted in the interactive rebase view

fields.description:
From Bitbucket web app, I select remote repository and attempt to clone it.  I click the button to Clone in Sourcetree.  Unfortunately, I encounter the following error message:

Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote ssh://git@csgit.harris.com:7999/dosss/harris.rf.pps.plugin.rf345mmp.git
Output: 
Error: FATAL ERROR: Disconnected: No supported authentication methods available (server sent: publickey)
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

I can execute the same command above successfully in Git bash.  So far the only way I can clone remote repository is using the command line interface in Git bash.  Note that I use Pageant to add private SSH key that corresponds to public SSH key that I added to my account on the Bitbucket server.

On another matter, I want to point out that I could not sign up for account with Microsoft Edge browser. But I succeeded in signing up for account with Chrome browser.
fields.summary: Unable to clone remote repository

fields.description:
When viewing a commit in a branch, click on a binary file. The panel to the right shows buttons [Open 'Before'] and [Open 'After']. Add dynamic buttons based on the .gitconfig in context. 
e.g. a button named [Difftool 'ExcelMerge'] comes from this item in the .gitconfig
[difftool "ExcelMerge"]
    cmd = \"C:/Program Files (x86)/ExcelMerge/ExcelMerge.GUI.exe\" diff -s \"$LOCAL\" -d \"$REMOTE\" -c WinMerge -i -w -v -k
fields.summary: Add difftool commands beside [Open 'Before'] and [Open 'After'] in file detail panel.

fields.description:
It would be excellent to have _Optional extended integration_ configuration available for Azure DevOps to aid with our (and many others') workflow. To be able to create PRs from SourceTree for DevOps would be a huge time saver.

!image-2019-01-14-09-37-17-832.png!
fields.summary: Optional extended integration for Azure DevOps

fields.description:
Some time ago I guess one of my PATs (Personal Access Tokens) for Azure DevOps expired. SourceTree asked me to login and ever since I have been spammed by mails from Azure DevOps whenever I keep SourceTree open.

I created a support ticket with Microsoft Azure DevOps team but after checking they send me here.

It seems like SourceTree keeps creating new PATs instead of caching existing ones that expire in a year! This is really anoying since Azure DevOps keeps sending me mail-notifications every single time a new PAT is created!
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps getting PATs which spam my inbox

fields.description: R
fields.summary: Remote button should not show red-bang badge when no remotes are defined

fields.description:
Windows or Mac



When you right-click on a file, you're given the option to "Remove" or "Discard," two synonymous verbs. Coming from git, I know the difference, but I still need to stop and think about which one I actually want each time.

The distinction between the two is in the noun they act on, so that should be included in the drop-down:
 * Remove *File*
 * Discard *Changes*
fields.summary: Please make distinction between "Remove" and "Discard" more clear

fields.description:
When you right-click on a file, you're given the option to "Remove" or "Discard," two synonymous verbs.  Coming from git, I know the difference, but I still need to stop and think about which one I actually want each time.

The distinction between the two is in the noun they act on, so that should be included in the drop-down:
* Remove *File*
* Discard *Changes*
fields.summary: Please make distinction between "Remove" and "Discard" more clear

fields.description:
After staging some files or changing to the commit tab the commit button (the one below the commit message) does not work (it is *not* greyed out). It is pressable but did not react, also the push to master checkbox is greyed out. After several seconds the checkbox becomes available and the commit button works.

Waiting all the time is annoying.
fields.summary: Commit button blocked
Number of pulls and pushes does not get cleared after a force push
UTF8 file with BOM breaks diff view

Do something about constant annoying Authenticate popups

fields.description:
After updating to 3.0.15 it is no longer possible to check for updates from within Sourcetree. A message box with the following text appears:

Invalid release entry: 7C20078B2B045E2C881187E39009FD85284F4E83 SourceTree-3.0.15-full.nupkg 23991659

This issue has been reported to the community forum several times but has not been fixed yet. The Atlassian service engineer that responded in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Error-sourcetree/qaq-p/971254 does not seem to understand the problem I'm afraid - the latest version that can be downloaded from sourcetreeapp.com is still only 3.0.12, even though 3.0.15 has been released.
fields.summary: Error message when checking for updates

fields.description:
Many of our company teammates are using the SourceTree as the Git client and it is pretty good in overall.

But regarding the tagging function, we're having a very annoying problem.

Normally we don't make a tag manually by each individual but the CI system makes some tags automatically when a new build is created.

Before we settled down with an agreed convention on tag naming, there were some experimentally created tags and we wanted to clear them out in order not to make an unwanted confusion. It looked just a simple straight forward thing, and removing them from the server and my local working copy was actually done easily.

However, since the Git is a distributed system the old wrong tags were already existed in other coworker's local repositories and +because the default status of "*Push all tags*" option is '*Checked*'+, those old tags were revived so many times when someone didn't sync their local tag with the remote server and pushed his/her commit with this option on, as the people didn't pay much attention on this option status and neither understand correctly what its impact is.

If once this situation happened we had to announce repeatedly to make sure this option is turned off and to sync their local working copy tags. 

I'm not so sure how many people are struggling with this issue but it was a surely annoying thing for us.

And so I want to know making its default status as unchecked would be acceptable for other users as well.

 

Best regards,

Oliver Cho

 

----------------------

Adding this feature request based on the question posted [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Can-you-please-make-the-default-status-of-quot-Push-all-tags/qaq-p/971859].
fields.summary: Changing the default status of "Push all tags" option as unchecked

fields.description:
Am using 2.4.8 version of Source tree and currently getting the Cygwin Error constantly when iam doing a Fetch or Pull. 

I have restarted , closed source tree many times and hasnt helped. 

Need immediate help on this issue.
fields.summary: Blocked by Cygwin error .need help

fields.description:
External Diff has been broken since 3.0 release.

I use P4Merge and every time I hit Ctrl+D it shows me error message about $Local and $Remote. Looks like they are not tokenized any more. And something is broken with Jira, so I cannot attach screenshot (Jira could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.)
fields.summary: External Diff is broken in 3.x

fields.description:
This problem also appeared on earlier versions. 

After a merge where there are lots of conflicts, the resulting automatic commit message consumes the right-hand pane and no stage or commit button is visible nor are there any handles to resize the message panel.
fields.summary: Long commit message hides commit button

fields.description:
The current OAuth flow for GitHub accounts only lists the user's public repositories by default (e.g. with nothing in the search field). Private repos only appear when searched for.
 * Private repos should be shown by default, or shown when a checkbox is active (similar to "Show Organization Repos"), or a UI element should be added to indicate that searching is required to view private repos.

However, regardless of the state of the "Show Organization Repos" checkbox, or what is being searched for, no organization private repos ever appear in the list. Organization public repos are untestable by me, since my GitHub account isn't a member of an organization that has public repos accessible through the OAuth flow.
 * Organization private repos should also be visible in this list.

A final note regarding the OAuth flow: I switched to Basic auth with only the repo and user permissions, and was able to see all the public repos of the organizations I'm in. I think this is working as intended, because the Authorized OAuth Apps section of GitHub lists SourcetreeForWindows as not having access to that specific organization that has public repos.
fields.summary: GitHub private repos aren't listed by default in Remote repositories

fields.description: Right now, when I inspect changes with keyboard and I decide to add change to commit, I hit ctrl+shifl+plus. But then next change should be selected for inspection. Right now changes (unstaged files section) are unselected so I must use mouse again to select another change.  This makes keyboard support kind of useless as I rather do everything with mouse in current state (but I want to use keyboard in the end)
fields.summary: In working copy view, when I add selected change to the commit, next change should be selected for inspection.

fields.description:
After a restart of Sourcetree not all tabs are restored. Some are closed.

I found no rule which ones are closed. I think it keeps only 10 tabs open.
fields.summary: Some project tabs are not restored after restart

fields.description:
I think that the problem is with Windows folders that have 'blanks spaces' in their name.

{code:html}
Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c credential.helper= -c credential.helper="C:/Users/My User Name With Blank Spaces/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras/git-credential-manager.exe" ls-remote https://my_user_bitbucket@bitbucket.org/my_user_bitbucket/my_repository.git
Output: 
Error: C:/Users/My User Name With Blank Spaces/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras/git-credential-manager.exe get: C:/Users/My: No such file or directory
C:/Users/My User Name With Blank Spaces/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/git_extras/git-credential-manager.exe erase: C:/Users/My: No such file or directory
remote: Invalid username or password
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://my_user_bitbucket@bitbucket.org/my_user_bitbucket/my_repository.git/'

{code}
fields.summary: Folder with blank spaces

fields.description:
It is not possible to install he MSI Installation package of SourceTree Enterprise in a 32 bit  Windows 7 version.
tried versions: 2.6.10 and 3.0.8

*Steps to reproduce*

*Expected result*

*Actual result*
Error Message: "Dieses Installationspaket wird auf dieser Plattform nicht unterstützt. Wenden Sie sich an den Hersteller des Produkts." (This installation package is not supported in this platform. Please contact the vendor of this product.)

fields.description:
Since I updated my SourceTree a while ago the "External Diff" is not working anymore. I do not remember the exact version it started to fail.

The internal diff shows the differences but I would like to use my installed WinMerge for diffs.

I checked the <HOME_DIR>\.gitconfig and it contains the following:
{code:java}
[difftool "sourcetree"]
 cmd = 'C:/Program Files (x86)/WinMerge/WinMergeU.exe' $LOCAL $REMOTE
[mergetool "sourcetree"]
 cmd = 'C:/Program Files (x86)/WinMerge/WinMergeU.exe' $LOCAL $REMOTE $MERGED
 trustExitCode = true
[merge]
 tool = sourcetree
[diff]
 guitool = sourcetree {code}
I opened the "Process Viewer" and executed the "External Diff" command. It reports
{code:java}
Unknown merge tool sourcetree
fatal: external diff died, stopping at <relative_path_to_my_file> {code}
I stored the "Process Viewer" log to XML, copied out the GIT command line and executed in CMD.exe: it worked as expected and opened WinMerge.

I tried configuring the "External Diff/Merge" section in Tools -> Options using "WinMerge", "Custom" or any other tool: no change

I switched "GIT Version" to "System": no change

I updated the embedded GIT: no change

I switched off using "LibGit2 integration": no change
fields.summary: External diff tool doesn't launch
Width of the project selection window

fields.description: It would be great to have the branch name the commit is on when it is selected in the "Workflow" (sorry if that's not the correct name) pane. A little tag is displayed of the branch's name in some cases (maybe gets removed when the branch gets deleted in git??) but in case there are many branches it can get a bit laborious to try and track down what's what just by following the "tram lines".  There's usually plenty of space in the details pane, maybe between `Commit` and `Parents`?
fields.summary: Show branch name when a commit is selected

fields.description: It would be a time saving feature if users were able to pull the current repository's all branches at once. Currently it is an option for Push but not Pull, so you have to switch to every branch, click Pull and submit pull options. This is very tedious when you need to bring the repository up to date but it has a lot of branches.
fields.summary: Ability to pull all branches at once

fields.description: If a user double-clicks on a local branch name in the expanded Branches panel and moves the mouse cursor before the pop-up progress dialog "switching branches" completes. Sourcetree will instead load the branch that the mouse moved to instead of loading the branch that was double-clicked.
fields.summary: Moving Mouse after Double-Clicking local Branch Will Instead Load Branch Mouse Is Hovering Over

fields.description:
I always get weird search results when searching branches for file changes.
When I select a branch, select the Search tab and switch to File Changes I get the following outcomes:
 * Even though a newer commit is available, I only get older ones (commited today, but result list starts with a commit from 6 days ago and backwards)
 * Some results do not even include the file I am searching for and none of the files in the commit or any of the text changes in that file contain my search string
 * searching for a concrete file with extension (.cs) does not list any commits at all
fields.summary: Search File Changes returns bad results

fields.description:
It would be nice if SourceTree supported the git rename/move command.

Presently:
 * The user needs to press terminal and enter "git mv oldname newname"

Wish:
 * In the file status highlight a file and choose "Rename/move"
 * Highlight more files and choose "Move"

The "log selected" in SourceTree already support the "follow renamed files" feature, so that is already in place.

In  SRCTREEWIN-821 it has been mentioned that you can move the file in windows explorer, but then the connection between the new file and the old file is lost. Especially moving files is essential to constantly refining architecture, and therefore important for SourceTree to support.
fields.summary: Preserve file history when renaming/moving file

fields.summary: When registering in the middle of the text, space characters are available.

fields.description:
Since several version (some of the last releasted for the 2.x and all of the 3.x) it is impossible to use the Diff/Merge tools, at least with BeyondCompare.

The problem is that when SourceTree creates the process, it apparently does NOT substitute the {{$LOCAL}}, {{$REMOTE}}, {{$BASE}}, {{$MERGED}} variables for the correct filenames, thus the process gets created with incorrect parameters, something like this:
{code:java}
"C:\Program Files\Beyond Compare 4\BComp.exe" \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\" "e:\temp\extdiff.lvsswo\4.0.a83bd46717c6\reportes\RepContratos\VRAVentasPorPauta95.cpp" "4.0.9443a11bb1b7\reportes\RepContratos\VRAVentasPorPauta95.cpp"{code}
Note the {{$LOCAL}} and {{$REMOTE}} parameters on the created process.

This example is for a diff call. SourceTree appends the correct filenames to the process, but leaves the variables in place, which doesn't work for the tool. For diff it is possible to workaround the issue: deleting the parameters from the Diff configuration works. But for merge, which needs more data/parameters it is not possible to workaround it like this.

This happens not only with the "BeyondCompare" option, but also with the Custom one. I haven't tried others, but if the Custom one fails I am guessing it will fail for all of them.

I have tried removing the {{\"}}, the backslash, and the {{"}} characters and it doesn't matter, the {{$VARIABLE}} is not being replaced.

I have tried in the two computers I have at hand and some virtual ones and the same happens. I have updated, uninstalled and then reinstalled, and so on, and it's always the same result.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not replace the $LOCAL, $REMOTE, etc., variables when calling the diff/merge tools

fields.description:
Text displays incorrectly when the diff line is stupid long.

I'm committing my VS Settings, and the first line of the file is 34,053 characters long, which causes a visual error in Sourcetree:

!image-2018-12-17-11-24-22-645.png!
fields.summary: Visual error in file with long first line (.vssettings)

fields.description:
In any environment - I request for new feature as usability aspects

 

currently when the commit gets rejected SourceTree shows hints (text format) which is nice . But if we have instead of textual hints a command palate or a buttons popup so that user does not have to click so many times  it would be great

e.g. steps 

 
 # create a repo add a text file with 3 any text lines, commit and push 
 # clone in sourcetree
 # edit the text file directly in Bitbucket or github  with some text and in line number 2
 # push directly in the browser ,
 # Now , in local machine we are behind as we have updated directly on the web , so Edit the same file, in the same line with different text (basically introducing conflict)
 # now commit and push from source tree, It will get rejected and here if you click on detail output it will show hints - your repo is behind remote so use git pull
 # These hints are really good but instead if you show a pop up with possible commands - only possible items are  - pull with merge, pull with rebase , discard, etc. so It will not only save the users clicks , but improve the experience.  

To check out the behaviour - check GitExtensions, they have implemented this and it prompts the user to select right set of commands and it is less painful as the clicks are less.
fields.summary: Instead of textual hints when the commit gets rejected, show a series of commands

fields.description:

fields.description: Discovered something strange.   If I create a feature branch and use a forward slash "/".   It is named "feature/...../...".  When you go to  finish it wants me to finish but the branch disappears from the list to finish.    I corrected by renaming the feature branch removing the /.   No errors go thrown

The file names submitted to the external diff tool appear reasonable (e.g. "C:\Users\Foo\AppData\Local\Temp\JHQYPa_.gitignore"), but the temporary files aren't there (nor anywhere else for that matter).
